intro: Crudia monophylla, commonly known as the single-leaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a low-growing habit with a single, spoon-shaped leaf and small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
